Computational Fluid Mechanics saw it’s emergence in the oil and gas industry in the 90s and has since grown to become fundamental to it’s effective functioning. The predictive capabilities of the fluid flow modelling have become essential to many oil and gas companies. Computational fluid dynamics is that branch of fluid mechanics which uses the algorithms and numerical methods for solving the real-life problems involving fluid flow. CFD is a powerful tool in the hands of professionals to understand problems ranging from an oil reservoir, on-shore or off-shore, it’s transfer through pipe lines or the refinery. CFD provides the virtual environment to work, through which several decisions, preventions, equipment designing and improvements can be made efficiently which saves time and money.\n\n
This 2 day workshop is sure to cover all the basics of this highly desired skill. This course will address all the basic concepts hence previous experience on the topic is not required and all attendees will be brought to the same level. This will also offer a practical experience on case studies and peer learning through group discussions leaving you enriched and motivated to take up the skill in detail professionally.

In the wake of fluctuating oil prices, it has become important to discover and adopt new technologies to improve operational efficiency to cut costs and improve predictability. Machine learning algorithms aided by a large number of computer servers have the ability to process billions of data points and use several techniques such as case based learning, drilling floor automation etc to supply meaningful insights . These techniques can be employed throughout all streams of the industry but it lags as a whole in employing Machine learning to it's full potential. Data must be made more available to better decision making algorithms. In such times it should become the primary focus of us, the future energy suppliers to acquire these skills with expertise to improve the situations for coming years.
